intro: Mastigostyla briquetii, commonly known as the African waterwheel, is a member of the Hydrocharitaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is an aquatic plant characterized by its whorled arrangement of long, narrow leaves that radiate from a central stem. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and marshes. Its roots are often submerged, and it can form dense mats that provide habitat for various aquatic organisms. Mastigostyla briquetii is noted for its ability to thrive in still or slow-moving water environments.
